title: How to Look Good with a Small Chest

steps.title: Wear more strapless tops and sheer shoulders.
steps.content: Wear more strapless tops and sheer shoulders. These tops are notoriously difficult to wear bras with, since the strap of a traditional bra will show through. Women with flat chests can don these tops while going braless. They can opt for a strapless bra. Some women with larger busts may not feel very supported in a strapless bra, but the support often proves plenty for women with smaller busts.

steps.title: Try a dress with open sides.
steps.content: Try a dress with open sides. These dresses do not look good with bras since you can see the wearer's side. For the same reason, these dresses do not often suit women with larger busts, since so much of the chest is exposed while wearing the dress. Women with flatter chests, however, can get away with exposing a little of what they have without needing to worry about looking inappropriate doing so.

steps.title: Wear a scarf or bandana as a top.
steps.content: Wear a scarf or bandana as a top. This works especially well with Hermes scarves and other large square styles. Women with smaller busts can pull this look off easily since tops made out of scarves are often delicately tied together, whereas women with larger busts may worry about "falling out" of such tops. Many of these tops often require the wearer to go braless, which is another reason why it is more suitable for women with flat chests. Wear a scarf as a fitted halter. Fold the scarf in half so that it looks like a triangle. Tie the two tail ends around your waist and tie the two layers of the top point around your neck. Alternatively, wear it as a sleeveless top. Fold two opposite corners of the scarf to the scarf's center. Tie the scarf around yourself, keeping the folded edges at the top and bottom.

steps.title: Try a bandeau top.
steps.content: Try a bandeau top. A bandeau top is a strip of cloth that ties around the breasts, exposing the stomach. The bandeau is not appropriate for all settings, but you can wear it for a stroll on a beach boardwalk or while on an island vacation. You can also wear it beneath an open sweater or jacket for a slightly more appropriate option that works in more settings.

steps.title: Look at backless gowns.
steps.content: Look at backless gowns. As another notoriously difficult top to wear a bra with, strapless gowns are perfect for women with flatter chests.

steps.title: Try clothing tailored to look masculine.
steps.content: Try clothing tailored to look masculine. Instead of fighting against your lack of curves, roll with it. Think “men's style” jackets, fitted graphic t-shirts with traditionally tough, masculine images, and “boyfriend” jeans. Pull the look together by accessorizing with gunmetal jewelry and thick-banded watches. This is a highly chic type of style that flat-chested women are in the perfect position to take advantage of.

steps.title: Search out cropped jackets and boleros.
steps.content: Search out cropped jackets and boleros. Many of these garments end just below the bust line, accentuating the bosom. These jackets do not suit women with larger chests well, since the style often makes the chest look fuller.

steps.title: Play with color.
steps.content: Play with color. Opt for pastels and other light colors, especially across the bust. Dark colors have a slimming effect, which could make your chest look smaller.

steps.title: Try wearing horizontal stripes across your chest.
steps.content: Try wearing horizontal stripes across your chest. Horizontal stripes have a widening effect, which often helps small chests look fuller.

steps.title: Look for blouses with horizontal stripes across the chest, but a solid color beneath the bust, covering the rest of the torso.
steps.content: Look for blouses with horizontal stripes across the chest, but a solid color beneath the bust, covering the rest of the torso. This further intensifies the effect of the stripes. The same principle can be applied to other patterns, as well. Match a pattern over your bust with a solid color covering your stomach.

steps.title: Consider polka dots, geometric shapes, and floral prints.
steps.content: Consider polka dots, geometric shapes, and floral prints. Try a few different patterns on and determine what suits your body and your personality best.

steps.title: Avoid baggy, loose clothes that look sloppy.
steps.content: Avoid baggy, loose clothes that look sloppy. This does nothing but conceal the curves you do have.

steps.title: Look for tops and dresses with an empire waist.
steps.content: Look for tops and dresses with an empire waist. Empire waists help the bust look larger while masking the midsection, making this an especially good option for women with petite busts and wider midsections. Consider an empire waist if you have a petite stomach, as well.

steps.title: Try on tops and dresses with nipped waists, since these help create the appearance of an hourglass figure.
steps.content: Try on tops and dresses with nipped waists, since these help create the appearance of an hourglass figure.

steps.title: Also try on snug wrap blouses and dresses to help create the appearance of a curvy hourglass figure.
steps.content: Also try on snug wrap blouses and dresses to help create the appearance of a curvy hourglass figure.

steps.title: Consider tight tops.
steps.content: Consider tight tops. Women with flatter chests can get away with wearing snug tops without looking inappropriate.

steps.title: Look at cowl necklines.
steps.content: Look at cowl necklines. The extra drapes and folds up top help the chest look fuller.

steps.title: Consider high collars, interesting asymmetrical necks, and crew necks to help your bust look bigger.
steps.content: Consider high collars, interesting asymmetrical necks, and crew necks to help your bust look bigger.

steps.title: Go for a halter top.
steps.content: Go for a halter top. Halter tops expose your shoulders and create an illusion of larger breasts by drawing the eye directly to the bosom.

steps.title: Try daring necklines like low v-necks and dramatic scoops.
steps.content: Try daring necklines like low v-necks and dramatic scoops. Even though these necklines do not necessarily make your bust look bigger, you can wear them and look classy doing so. Women with larger busts risk looking inappropriate in a low neckline, but women with smaller busts can get away with showing more skin and still look appropriate doing so.

steps.title: Try a blouse or dress with ruffles or pleats, especially those that trim the neckline.
steps.content: Try a blouse or dress with ruffles or pleats, especially those that trim the neckline. This adds volume to your chest without overwhelming your figure.

steps.title: Look for tops with details at the bust.
steps.content: Look for tops with details at the bust. Empire waist shirts with a bit of embellishment right along the waistline work especially well.

steps.title: Consider tops with embellishments around the collar.
steps.content: Consider tops with embellishments around the collar. A splash of color or a glimmer of gold or silver sequins will elongate your neck, drawing the focus away from the flatness of your chest.

steps.title: Match a billowy blouse or tunic with tight jeans to show off great legs.
steps.content: Match a billowy blouse or tunic with tight jeans to show off great legs. Wear the outfit with your favorite high heels to further elongate your leg.

steps.title: Pair a fitted blouse with a knee-length pencil skirt to show off a flat stomach and curvy hips.
steps.content: Pair a fitted blouse with a knee-length pencil skirt to show off a flat stomach and curvy hips.

steps.title: Wear sleeveless tanks and spaghetti-strap dresses to show off slender, delicate arms.
steps.content: Wear sleeveless tanks and spaghetti-strap dresses to show off slender, delicate arms.

steps.title: Consider necklaces with thin chains and small pendants to make your bust look bigger by comparison.
steps.content: Consider necklaces with thin chains and small pendants to make your bust look bigger by comparison.

steps.title: Draw the attention away from your chest with chunky bracelets, rings, and bold earrings.
steps.content: Draw the attention away from your chest with chunky bracelets, rings, and bold earrings.

steps.title: Also try out a bold necklace with a shorter chain.
steps.content: Also try out a bold necklace with a shorter chain. A loud, noticeable piece of jewelry at your neck may also steer the eye away from the chest.

steps.title: Use blush to enhance the appearance of your breasts.
steps.content: Use blush to enhance the appearance of your breasts. Choose a blush one shade darker than your natural skin tone. Apply a light coating of this blush to the skin in between your breasts. This creates false shadows that give off the illusion of a larger chest. Avoid using a blush that is lighter than your skin tone or too many shades darker.

steps.title: Apply glitter body dust to enhance your breasts' appearance.
steps.content: Apply glitter body dust to enhance your breasts' appearance. Apply a light, subtle dusting of this glitter to the top of each breast. This highlights the rounded top, ultimately creating a fuller look. Avoid applying glitter gels or other types of heavy body glimmer.
